meanings.definition: A large retail store that combines a supermarket and a department store.
meanings.sent1: I went to the supercenters to buy groceries and clothes in one place.
meanings.sent2: The supercenters in our town have everything from fresh produce to electronics.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tomato go to the supercenters? To catch up on the latest fashion trends!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a supercenters of knowledge, with each aisle representing a different subject.
meanings.sent5: The supercenters stood out in the city skyline, a beacon of convenience for all shoppers.

meanings.definition: The largest type of retail store, typically offering a wide variety of products and services.
meanings.sent1: We decided to visit the supercenters for all our shopping needs.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, the supercenters were bustling with customers looking for gifts.
meanings.sent3: The supercenters threw a party for all the other stores, showing off their impressive selection.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, the supercenters were like a treasure trove, full of surprises at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The supercenters loomed large in the distance, promising endless options for shoppers.
